publications.name: A non-Archimedean theory of complex spaces and the cscK problem
publications.summary: In this paper I construct a space of valuations attached to a compact complex manifold, that generalize the Berkovich analytification of a projective variety over C. As an application I get a sufficient algebraic  condition for the existence of constant scalar curvature Kähler metrics on a given Kähler class on a Kähler manifold.

publications.name: A transcendental non-Archimedean Calabi--Yau Theorem with applications to the cscK problem
publications.summary: Let X be a compact Kähler manifold and α a Kähler class on X. We prove that if (X,α) is uniformly K-stable for models, then there is a unique cscK metric in α. This was first proved in the algebraic case by Chi Li, and it strengthens a related result in an article of Mesquita-Piccione. K-stability for models is defined in terms of big test configurations, but we also give a valuative criterion as in the work of Boucksom--Jonsson together with an explicit formula for the associated β-invariant. To accomplish this we further develop the non-Archimedean pluripotential theory in the transcendental setting, as initiated in the works of Darvas--Xia--Zhang and Mesquita-Piccione. In particular we prove the continuity of envelopes and orthogonality properties, and using that, we are able to extend the non-Archimedean Calabi-Yau Theorem found in an article of Boucksom--Jonsson to the general Kähler setting.
